intro: Gratiola dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Gratiola dilatata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
